etymons.meaning: to absolve, exonetrate; to be merciful; to expiate, forgive

Infectum.text: omər “baʕ min d-omanno?” omər “amár: alo mḥasele” ʻHe says: “What should I say?” “Say: God may bless him”ʼ; 419; 41/30; i=naqqa d-ko-moyəṯ u=miṯo am=mor-ayḏe ko-saymi-le arbʕo=muklone (…) ko-masuʕi u=ʕamo d-i=qriṯo kule yaʕni hul alfo=šaxṣat i=naqqa d-u=ʕamo k-uxli kə-mḥasən hənnək w-aq=qaše b-u=miṯo k-əmmi aloho mḥase-le yaʕni aloho ʕofe-le ‘When someone dies, his relatives give four funeral feasts for him (…) they sate the whole village, up to one thousand people. When the villagers eat, they and the priests pray for him to God and say “aloho mḥase-le!” which means “Lord, have mercy on him” 94/50;

Preterit.text: Ínaqla u+ʕAzo dbe Marre, bu+yawmo mḥase, Ăloho mḥasele Once ʕAzo Marre, he died recently, God bless him (HD 91)

Infectum.text: miḥase babox, babayxu ʻmöge euer Vater selig werdenʼ; 423; 59/27; miḥasina b-a=ṣlawoṯayḏux ʻmögen wir durch deine Gebete erlöst werdenʼ LB 376;

Part. Pass..text: qay gd-uxlat-li? mḥasyo d-babi w babox aḥunóne-way-ne ʻwarum willst du mich fressen? mein Vater selig und dein Vater waren ja doch Freundeʼ; 424; prs 197/33; 86/1;

ḥaḏ̣irina harke gab Šahino, u=zlām d-i=mḥasayto d-Marto də-mḥasyo lalye d-arbʕo ḥamšo w ʕəsri b-u=yarḥ-ano ʻwir sind hier bei Šahino zusammengekommen, dem Ehemann der seligen Marto, die am Dienstag Abend den 25 diesen Monats verstarbʼ; LB 3;

idioms: ḥṣy III ‘to shut’: pret. maḥṣele ‘he shut’ (SZ 15.2)
